title: What is scope of AI and Machine Learning in India? - Quora

response.answer_text: Research by Gartner reveals that AI will create nearly 2.3 million new opportunities by 2020. In fact, vacancies for artificial intelligence jobs have doubled in the past three years. Why? Because the current IT talent pool views AI and ML jobs as the gateway to a rewarding career path and lucrative paycheck. Despite concerns that AI will take over automation and smart device jobs, machines are yet to reach the stage where they govern our everyday lives. So, aspiring candidates searching for job in the AI or ML industry will get plenty of opportunities, including: Data Scientist: Primarily responsible for the collection, analysis, interpretation of data from different touchpoints, data scientists draw insights and inferences to devise effective solutions for businesses. Data science draws heavily from AI and ML, where techniques like predictive analytics and regression are used to generate insights.Machine Learning Engineer: One of the most popular AI jobs right now, huge demand of machine learning engineers for their expertise in software, applied math, natural language processing, and tools like Eclipse, IntelliJ, and more. Aspirants in the fields of artificial intelligence and machine learning should consider this career path.Business Intelligence Developer: Combining business acumen with ML and AI skills, business intelligence developers are responsible for the growth of the company.Aside from these options, jobs in ML and AI also include job roles such as data analyst, full stack developer, research scientist, product manager, front-end developer, and data warehouse engineer. How to become a good machine learning engineer and what are the career option for them. Visit our website “upGrad” to know more.

Yes, there is a great scope for AI and ML in India. My favourite part about it is that it can provide easy access to health and financial aid through the use of mobile application chat bots. Since most Indians already own mobile phones, but very few have access to basic amenities, it brings all the services to the tip of their finger. Beyond this, AI and ML will be doing most of the basic, admin tasks and while it would mean overall drop in rate of employment, it could also push for the government to bring about Universal Basic Income. As the money will be generated by organisations, the wealth can be distributed amongst the people. However, this also means that the government could come under the control of a company - which is very concerning. (If you like this answer, please hit follow!)
